Problem:
Consider a control system where the state vector \\(x(t)\\) evolves according to the linear time-invariant system \\(\\dot{x} = Ax + Bu\\), with A and B being constant matrices and \\(u(t)\\) an input vector. We are interested in examining the effects of implementing an input transformation \\(u(t) = D v(t)\\), where D is a constant matrix and \\(v(t)\\) represents a new transformed input.

After observing the state \\(x(t)\\) at t = T, can we determine the original input \\(u(t)\\) at t = 0 without knowing whether the transformation \\(D v(t)\\) was applied?
Explanation: Without knowledge of the input transformation, it is impossible to uniquely reverse-engineer \\(u(t)\\) from \\(x(t)\\) at T. The transformation by D could have altered the input in a non-identifiable way, especially if B and D are not easily invertible or distinguishable in their effects.
